Package edu.sru.thangiah.datastructures.tree.heaptree

Class MaxHeapTree

java.lang.Object
edu.sru.thangiah.datastructures.tree.heaptree.AbstractHeapTree
edu.sru.thangiah.datastructures.tree.heaptree.MaxHeapTree
All Implemented Interfaces:
BaseOpsInt, TreeOpsInt, TreeSearchOps, TreeTraversalOps
public class MaxHeapTree extends AbstractHeapTree

Title: MaxHeapTreeGeneric

Description:

Implementation of int max heap tree. Note that since heap trees are self-balancing any insertion/deletion causes the heap tree to sift up or sift down the values in the tree. Because this structure works in a similar manner as a sorting algorithm we allow the user to call the printSortedArray method which sorts the tree and prints it out in a readable format.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Sam R. Thangiah

    • getParentNode

      public int getParentNode(int element)
      the parent node can be calculated by taking the index passed divided by 2. Since we start at index 1 we don't need to worry about the extra subtraction from the index if we started at 0
      Parameters:
      element - - the node in the heap tree which we are trying to get the parent of
      Returns:
      The parent node

    • getLeftChildNode

      public int getLeftChildNode(int element)
      the left child node can be calculated by taking the index passed and multiplying it by 2. If we started at index 0 the formula would be (2 * element) +1
      Parameters:
      element - - The node in the heap tree which we are trying to get the left child of
      Returns:
      The left child

    • getRightChildNode

      public int getRightChildNode(int element)
      the right child node can be calculated by taking the index passed multiplied by two and then added by 1. If we started at index 0 the formula would be (2 * element) + 2
      Parameters:
      element - - The node in the heap tree which we are trying to get the right child of
      Returns:
      The right child

    • levelOrder

      public void levelOrder()
      given the height of the heap tree, we call printGivenLevel for each height index until height is reached

    • printGivenLevel

      public void printGivenLevel(HeapTreeNode root, int level)
      starting at the level parameter set by method call in levelOrder, we go through recursively printing out each node within the level, passing in left or right as well as the level-1 in order to ensure we are actually fetching the next node in the level
      Parameters:
      root - - The root node of the tree
      level - - The current level we are at in the tree
